page.title: 08FARMING (cont.,2nd page)
page.content: {Machinary}found on farms: tractors, grass toppers. ploughs loaders, bailers,silage block cutters, landrover,crop sparayers,4wheel drive tractors. {HEMPSTER FARM.} 45 ACRES. Oldest existing building 1650. Land use: grazing, hay and coniferous woodland. On the farm they grow lots of soft fruit, strawberries, rasberries and blackcurrants which members of the public can pick and buy. Polythene greenhouses are used to grow tomatoes courgettes and cucumbers. The water supply is from two wells. {BOWDEN FARM. }250 acres. The land is used for grazing bullocks and sheep. Machinary like tractor landrover trailers are used to make the work easier. Silage is brought in from another farm. Some hay is cut and stored.The farm house {cont page 9.
